segment.source: Use Field Medic to generate a report
segment.target: Use Field Medic to generate a report

segment.source: Use Field Medic to generate a report
segment.target: Use Field Medic to generate a report

segment.source: Use Field Medic to generate a report
segment.target: Use Field Medic to generate a report

segment.source: This topic explains how to create a report (called "recording" a report).
segment.target: This topic explains how to create a report (called "recording" a report).

segment.source: For information about Field Medic, see Field Medic.
segment.target: For information about Field Medic, see Field Medic.

segment.source: Recording a Field Medic report
segment.target: Recording a Field Medic report

segment.source: To record device information in a Field Medic report, use the following steps.
segment.target: To record device information in a Field Medic report, use the following steps.

segment.source: Run the Field Medic app.
segment.target: Run the Field Medic app.

segment.source: Tap Advanced.
segment.target: Tap Advanced.

segment.source: Select the categories that you want to include in the report.
segment.target: Select the categories that you want to include in the report.

segment.source: Press the Back button to return to the main Field Medic screen.
segment.target: Press the Back button to return to the main Field Medic screen.

segment.source: Tap Start Logging.
segment.target: Tap Start Logging.

segment.source: field medic menu
segment.target: field medic menu

segment.source: After you start logging, Field Medic displays the elapsed capture time under the Stop Logging option.
segment.target: After you start logging, Field Medic displays the elapsed capture time under the Stop Logging option.

segment.source: Close Field Medic by pressing the Back or Start button.
segment.target: Close Field Medic by pressing the Back or Start button.

segment.source: Reproduce the problem that you want to collect information about.
segment.target: Reproduce the problem that you want to collect information about.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: ETW logging for the selected categories remains enabled, even after the device reboots, until you stop logging.
segment.target: ETW logging for the selected categories remains enabled, even after the device reboots, until you stop logging.

segment.source: field medics menu report in session
segment.target: field medics menu report in session

segment.source: After you have reproduced the problem, run Field Medic and tap Stop Logging.
segment.target: After you have reproduced the problem, run Field Medic and tap Stop Logging.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: It can take five seconds or longer for Field Medic to stop ETW sessions and create the report files.
segment.target: It can take five seconds or longer for Field Medic to stop ETW sessions and create the report files.

segment.source: field medics menu stop reporting
segment.target: field medics menu stop reporting

segment.source: You can view, edit, and delete the list of captured reports by tapping View Reports on the main screen.
segment.target: You can view, edit, and delete the list of captured reports by tapping View Reports on the main screen.

segment.source: field medics reports menu
segment.target: field medics reports menu

segment.source: By default, reports shown in the reports screen are named with the format of “WPBDateTime.”
segment.target: By default, reports shown in the reports screen are named with the format of “WPBDateTime.”

segment.source: You can press and hold a report in the list to delete, edit, or view the files associated with the report.
segment.target: You can press and hold a report in the list to delete, edit, or view the files associated with the report.

segment.source: field medics report options
segment.target: field medics report options

segment.source: You can use tools such as Xperf and Tracerpt, and ETWDump to examine the ETL files.
segment.target: You can use tools such as Xperf and Tracerpt, and ETWDump to examine the ETL files.

segment.source: View log files in a Field Medic report
segment.target: View log files in a Field Medic report

segment.source: To extract a Field Medic report, connect the device to a computer with a USB cable.
segment.target: To extract a Field Medic report, connect the device to a computer with a USB cable.

segment.source: Copy the Field Medic report from your device (either the root of the device or the root of the SD card) to your PC.
segment.target: Copy the Field Medic report from your device (either the root of the device or the root of the SD card) to your PC.

segment.source: Each folder in this directory represents a different report and contains several ETW log files.
segment.target: Each folder in this directory represents a different report and contains several ETW log files.

segment.source: On your computer, locate ETWDump in the Windows Driver Kit.
segment.target: On your computer, locate ETWDump in the Windows Driver Kit.

segment.source: Example: C:Program Files (x86)Windows Kits10ToolFunnelEtwDump2.0EtwDump.exe
segment.target: Example: C:Program Files (x86)Windows Kits10ToolFunnelEtwDump2.0EtwDump.exe

segment.source: Locate the ETW manifest files in the Windows Driver Kit.
segment.target: Locate the ETW manifest files in the Windows Driver Kit.

segment.source: Example: C:Program Files (x86)Windows Kits10Manifests
segment.target: Example: C:Program Files (x86)Windows Kits10Manifests

segment.source: The mainifest (.mc) files contain formatting information that ETWDump uses to decode the log (.etl) files.
segment.target: The mainifest (.mc) files contain formatting information that ETWDump uses to decode the log (.etl) files.

segment.source: Open a Command Prompt window, and make sure the path to ETWDump.exe is on your Path environment variable.
segment.target: Open a Command Prompt window, and make sure the path to ETWDump.exe is on your Path environment variable.

segment.source: Here’s an example of using EtwDump to decode the FieldMedic-Contacts-Calendar.etl log file.
segment.target: Here’s an example of using EtwDump to decode the FieldMedic-Contacts-Calendar.etl log file.

segment.source: ETWDump is one of several tools you can use to decode ETW log files.
segment.target: ETWDump is one of several tools you can use to decode ETW log files.

segment.source: Here are some other tools you can use to decode ETW log files:
segment.target: Here are some other tools you can use to decode ETW log files:

segment.source: Xperf
segment.target: Xperf

segment.source: XPerf is included in the Windows Adaptation and Deployment Kit (ADK).
segment.target: XPerf is included in the Windows Adaptation and Deployment Kit (ADK).

segment.source: Tracerpt
segment.target: Tracerpt

segment.source: Tracerpt is included in Windows.
segment.target: Tracerpt is included in Windows.

segment.source: Specify advanced options
segment.target: Specify advanced options

segment.source: Open the Field Medic app and tap Advanced.
segment.target: Open the Field Medic app and tap Advanced.

segment.source: As shown previously, you can select the ETW provider categories that you want to include in your report.
segment.target: As shown previously, you can select the ETW provider categories that you want to include in your report.

segment.source: You can also specify whether to include these items in your report:
segment.target: You can also specify whether to include these items in your report:

segment.source: System logs and crash dumps (Default or Full)
segment.target: System logs and crash dumps (Default or Full)

segment.source: Netlogs
segment.target: Netlogs

segment.source: QXDM logs
segment.target: QXDM logs

segment.source: Note To get crash dumps, you must opt in for feedback in the main OS settings screen.
segment.target: Note To get crash dumps, you must opt in for feedback in the main OS settings screen.

segment.source: After you opt in, crash dump information is periodically sent to Microsoft when the device is charging and connected to a Wi-Fi network.
segment.target: After you opt in, crash dump information is periodically sent to Microsoft when the device is charging and connected to a Wi-Fi network.

segment.source: When a Field Medic report is in session, the crash reports are not sent to Microsoft, but are included in the Field Medic reports.
segment.target: When a Field Medic report is in session, the crash reports are not sent to Microsoft, but are included in the Field Medic reports.

segment.source: Any crash dumps that are currently not uploaded to Microsoft before a Field Medic report is recorded are also included in the next Field Medic report and will not be uploaded to Microsoft afterwards.
segment.target: Any crash dumps that are currently not uploaded to Microsoft before a Field Medic report is recorded are also included in the next Field Medic report and will not be uploaded to Microsoft afterwards.

segment.source: field medics advanced menu
segment.target: field medics advanced menu

segment.source: You can also specify that reports be stored on an SD card if one is available on the device.
segment.target: You can also specify that reports be stored on an SD card if one is available on the device.

segment.source: This is useful for devices that don’t have much space to store reports.
segment.target: This is useful for devices that don’t have much space to store reports.

segment.source: Tap Choose where to store reports, and then choose SDCard
segment.target: Tap Choose where to store reports, and then choose SDCard

segment.source: field medic categories menu
segment.target: field medic categories menu

segment.source: Specify custom loggers
segment.target: Specify custom loggers

segment.source: Field Medic can include reports from custom loggers that you specify.
segment.target: Field Medic can include reports from custom loggers that you specify.

segment.source: For more information, see Custom logging with Field Medic.
segment.target: For more information, see Custom logging with Field Medic.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Field Medic
